references.reason: This paper introduced the variational autoencoder (VAE), a fundamental model used in the current research and a key component of the proposed MMVM VAE.

references.paper_title: Multi-level variational autoencoder: Learning disentangled representations from grouped observations
references.reason: This work is highly relevant as it explores multi-view VAEs, a closely related concept to multimodal VAEs which shares several similarities in terms of handling multiple data modalities.

references.paper_title: On the Limitations of Multimodal VAEs
references.reason: This paper provides a critical analysis of existing multimodal VAEs, highlighting their limitations which are directly addressed by the proposed MMVM approach.

references.paper_title: Hippocampal ensembles represent sequential relationships among an extended sequence of nonspatial events
references.reason: This paper provides the real-world dataset used in the experiments section, showcasing the method's application to challenging real-world problems.

references.paper_title: Multimodal Generative Learning Utilizing Jensen-Shannon Divergence
references.reason: This paper introduced a previous multimodal VAE approach that is closely related to and improved upon by the current work.
